page.title: 04RAF LYNEHAM-THE FALKLANDS
page.content: THE TASK OF THE HERCULES DURING THE CAMPAIGN WAS FIRSTLY TO MOVE STORES AND PERSONNEL TO ASCENSION ISLAND BEFORE THE ARRIVAL OF THE TASK FORCE AND THEN, TO ESTABLISH A SPEEDY AND CONTINUOUS LINE OF SUPPLY OF PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT. SECONDLY THE HERCULES WAS USED TO RE-SUPPLY THE TASK FORCE SOUTH OF ASCENSION AND ON TO THE FALKLANDS AS WELL. THE AIRCRAFT HAD TO BE MODIFIED SO THAT THEY COULD BE REFUELLED IN THE AIR. THIS WAS A NEW ROLE FOR THE AIRCRAFT AND TRIALS WHICH BEGAN ON 3 MAY WERE COMPLETED A WEEK LATER. BY THE FALL OF STANLEY ON 14 JUNE A TOTAL OF 44 AIRDROPS OF EQUIPMENT AND MEN HAD BEEN MADE USING AIR-TO-AIR REFUELLING. ON 24 JUNE A R.A.F. HERCULES LANDED AT STANLEY FOR THE FIRST TIME.
